content.description: This is an interesting route in the cave to the right after you turn into the Spillway Campground. Stand start with a compression, and move up through a couple of positive and probably dirty rails until you hit the top lip of the rock. Move left and up using the lip, squeezing through the narrow opening between the walls until you reach the highest point of the lip, and then top out. Don't fall after you hit the lip, but the crux is the compression to start, so you'll probably be fine.
content.protection: Some pads, but more importantly don't fall.
content.location: It is to the right between two walls off the road when going into spillway.

content.description: This is a stand start, a bit of a one move wonder. Start with your right hand on a sidepull and your left hand in a slot down lower, compress, and get your right foot on the rail down right. Huck to the jug up left, throw some heels, and top out. If you did the sit start from the rail down right then moved up and left through a couple serious compressions before the dyno, I think it could go at like V6ish, 4 stars. I am not sure of the FA of either variations.
content.protection: 2+ pads. There's a big rock directly below, so maybe use a spotter.
content.location: It is on the big boulder up the hill from camp 2 3.

content.description: Behind #7 and #8, start standing with your hands in the juggy rail, and huck up and right to the next juggy rail. Top out carefully on some gritty stone. A SDS to this problem is possible but would require a considerable amount of cleaning.
Start on a huge undercling rail on the left side of boulder #7.
Behind the slab with problems 5 and 6 lies a massive boulder that freakishly resembles Jabba the Hutt.  Climb all over him!
content.protection: A crashpad or two if you plan on falling from the top.

content.description: This is an extended sit-start to #5. Start sitting right of the arete. Make a few powerful moves to the arete, then stay in balance as you turn the corner, and finish up the rest of #5.

A few hundred yards above camp 2, the hillside opens up into a relatively flat meadow. One of the first boulders you approach sports a slab of rock shadowed by a much larger boulder resting on top of it. This problem starts standing, and a good foothold allows you to reach a thin rail. From the rail, gain the arete, traverse up and left on foot smears and small edges, and top out at maximum height.

This problem is located left of #3 on the arete of the same boulder. Begin with your left hand in a small slot and right hand on a juggy sloper. Get your foot beta squared away and make a burly throw with your right hand to a blocky pinch. Your left hand then follows to a jug just over the lip from the pinch, then perform the trick mantel topout.
content.protection: A crashpad and a spotter, as there is a rock behind you that could be hazardous.

content.description: I'm sure someone has climbed this line before, but thought I'd add it. I'm also sure someone has added a couple moves at the start to make it a few grades harder. Start with your left hand in a vertical slot and your right hand in a lower pocket. Get your feet up, then work your way to the juggy sloper, throw your right hand up to the diagonal seam, get a heel up, then throw left to the high crimp, and top out. The mantel to the topout is tricky.
content.location:
Start below

Camp 2 4

, and finish on

Camp 2 3

.

content.description: Start sitting inside the cave/tunnel in camp 2.  Traverse up and left along a discontinuous seam to a tricky mantle topout.  The technical crux is V4ish but there is quite a bit of bouldering before and after that.
Just right of #1 in camp 2, start standing, and climb straight up the face.
To the right of the fire pit in Camp 2, start standing and follow the right trending lieback seam to jugs at the top.
